content.description: Sit start on the rails, then traverse right along the rails/crack.
content.location: On the left face of the boulder, facing downhill

content.description: Sit start on the nice rails, then use crimps and slopey cracks to move to the big jug/slopers at the top.  Might be doable as a cool dino.
content.location: on the left side of the boulder (facing downhill)

content.description: Sit start on a crimpy rail and use high feet to get to a slippery three-finger crimp.  Then mess with your feet and body position to go for the sidepull/jugs.  Go for a sort of pocket, then top out.  A great climb.  If you can figure out a beta that is able to skip the first move to the slippery crimp, the grade might drop a lot.
content.location: when you reach the clearing in front of Bauer rock, turn slightly right and walk downhill along the right side of Bauer.  There should be a feint trail.  The boulder is past Bauer, a bit to the right.  If you need to orient yourself, this is between Bauer and the Brain, a little more downhill.  The climb is on the slightly overhung downhill facing side of the boulder.

content.description: A boulder with two climbable sides.  The one facing downhill has a slight overhang.
